Procedural_Stage: Appeal before Refugee Appeal Division (RAD), Judicial Review
Evidence_Assessment: Flexible approach required; new evidence should be admitted with context consideration
Burden_of_Proof: On claimant to establish refugee status
Credibility_Factor: RPD's credibility findings improperly deferred to by RAD
Legal_Rule: RAD must conduct hybrid appeal and independently review RPD decisions
Standard_of_Review: Hybrid: reasonableness for findings, correctness for legal questions
Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness in evidence handling and credibility assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to identity concerns
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deficient: RAD failed to independently assess evidence and credibility
Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration and refugee law under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: RAD erred in deferring to RPD and rejecting new evidence
Court_Result: Remitted for reconsideration by a different RAD member
Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA, case law on standard of review
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA relating to refugee appeals and evidence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada (IRB)
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on appeal process and eligibility
Governing_Rule: Hybrid standard of review in administrative appeals
